title: Process Capability BenchmarkZ (Nines)
printObjectSummaryChk: Print QCC object summary for the process capability
label1: Two options - either select a variable (and a grouping variable as needed) or select the variables in dataset if already grouped
selectVariableRad: Option 1: Select a variable from the dataset (optionally that may need to be grouped)
groupingVariable: Grouping variable (optional - if the data needs to be grouped)
Good: Select a variable to designate as Good or Pass
Bad: Select a variable to designate as Bad or Fail
variableControlLimits: Data rows to be discarded, if any, before grouping for variable control limits ( e.g. specify as 1:25 or 1,4,5,7:12)
displayGroupsChk: Display the groupings on the dataset UI grid for reference only
selectDatasetRad: Option 2: Select the variables from the Dataset if already grouped
variablelistSelcted: Select one or more grouped variables (observed data) to analyze
rowsTobeUsed: If selected (grouped) rows to be used to analyze for process capability ( e.g.  specify as 1:25 or 1,4,5,7:12)
label4: Select whether to use the above as LSL or USL, and for Good/Pass or Bad/Fail
label5: Is above Specification for Good/Pass or Bad/Fail
chooseGoodforSL: Select if Specification Limit to apply for Good/Pass
chooseFailforSL: Select if Specification Limit to apply for Bad/Fail
target: Target - an optional value specifying the target of the process
addlSpecLines: Add additional Spec lines on the plot (comma separated e.g. 73.98, 74.01, 74.03)
addlSpecLinesLabel: Label for the additional Spec lines (comma separated e.g. Spec 1, Spec 2, Spec 3)
confidence_level: Confidence level - a value between 0 and 1 (default 0.95)
benchmarkZChkDigits: Digits to display in the nines table
numOfLastSubgroupsPlot: Number of last subgroups to be plotted
summarySixpackPlotChk: Sixpack (underlying I-MR, Xbar, R, S charts, Probability, and Capability plots)
nsigmas: Sigma - number of sigmas to use for computing control limits
stddev: Standard deviation method for Within-Subgroup variation
stddevR: Standard deviation method for R chart (for group size > 1 and < 9)
stddevS: Standard deviation method for S chart (for group size > 8)
stddevXbarOne: Standard deviation method for calculating I-MR
DoNotUseUnbiasingConstantChk: Do not use unbiasing constant to estimate std dev for overall process capability indices
digits: Digits to display on the capability plots
normalCurveHeightScaleFactor: Any number, including decimal, to scale the height of the normal curve (for stacked bar). Type 0 for no scaling
histogramBarPosition: Bar position, if a group is chosen (stacked or side-by-side)
legends: Show Legends and if so, position of Legends (default is right)
displaySLlineonPlotChk: Display Specification (LSL or USL) line on the underlying run charts
displaySLlineonHistPlotChk: Display Specification line on the histogram

help.title: Process Capability (qcc pkg)
help.body:
Description
qcc function to to computes capability indices

For the detail help - use R help(process.capability, package = qcc), help(qcc, package = qcc), help(sd.xbar, package = qcc), and help(sd.xbar.one, package = qcc)

To try this, you may load the dataset called pistonrings from the qcc package with Load Dataset menu by selecting qcc package and then select pistonrings dataset
Choose option 1, diameter to variable(observed..), sample to Grouping variable,
Type 1:25 in Grouped rows to be used
For Process capability analysis - type 73.95 in LSL, 74.05 in USL, and 74.0 in Target Limit

Follow the qcc tutorial at https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/qcc/vignettes/qcc_a_quick_tour.html

Standard Deviation Methods:
"UWAVE-R"
UnWeighted AVErage of subgroup estimates based on subgroup Ranges
max sample size supported is 25

"UWAVE-SD"
UnWeighted AVErage of subgroup estimates based on subgroup Standard Deviations

"MVLUE-R"
Minimum Variance Linear Unbiased Estimator computed as a weighted average of subgroups estimates based on subgroup Ranges
max sample size supported is 25

"MVLUE-SD"
Minimum Variance Linear Unbiased Estimator computed as a weighted average of subgroup estimates based on subgroup Standard Deviations

"RMSDF"
Root-Mean-Square estimator computed as a weighted average of subgroup estimates based on subgroup Standard Deviations

Mapping of terms:
Average of Unbiased SDs → UWAVE-SD
Average of Ranges → UWAVE-R
Unbiased Pooled SD → RMSDF
